items.title: Leveraging tax credits and incentives for sustainability projects

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Randa Barsoum of PwC US highlights tax credits and incentives for sustainability that extend beyond commonly cited energy incentives. She calls out state and local abatements, location-based incentives, and R&D tax credits tied to innovation (for example, reimagining packaging or processes) and advises leaders to view sustainability investments through a broader lens to unlock tax value.
bullets: Energy incentives are important but not the only tax lever for sustainability.
State and local abatements can support sustainability projects.
Location-based incentives matter for site and expansion decisions.
R&D tax credits may apply to innovation in packaging or processes.
Viewing sustainability investments broadly can unlock meaningful tax value.
takeaways: Donâ€™t limit incentive searches to energy creditsâ€”include state/local abatements and location-based incentives when planning sites or expansions.
Investigate R&D tax credits for process innovations that improve operational sustainability.
Treat sustainability investments as potential sources of tax value by broadening your incentive strategy.

items.title: Bringing In $251K A Year With 3 Jobs In The Bay Area

ai.summary: Based on the available description, Naseema McElroy, a 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse in Brentwood, California, started a personal finance brand after accumulating nearly $1 million in debt in 2015. She launched Financially Intentional to document her debt-payoff journey, became debt-free by 2017, and the video (titled "Bringing In $251K A Year With 3 Jobs In The Bay Area") is part of CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series.
bullets: Naseema McElroy is a 44-year-old labor and delivery nurse and founder of Financially Intentional.
She carried nearly $1 million in debt in 2015 and learned to manage her money to tackle it.
Naseema documented her debt payoff publicly and was debt-free by 2017.
The video title highlights earning $251K a year with three jobs in the Bay Area.
This story is featured in CNBC Make It's Millennial Money series.
takeaways: Multiple income streams can generate substantial annual revenue (title notes $251K from three jobs), suggesting diversification as a resilience strategy.
Documenting financial progress can catalyze a personal brand and create additional income or outreach opportunities, as shown by Financially Intentional.
Focused financial education and disciplined planning enabled rapid debt reduction (nearly $1M to debt-free by 2017), freeing resources for other priorities.
Earnings targets in high-cost regions like the Bay Area may be higher; benchmarking local income levels can inform financial planning and staffing cost models.

items.title: GeForce Garage - Summer of RTX Community Build

ai.summary: Based on the available description, this video announces the winner of the Summer of RTX r/buildapc Community Build contest, u/JeffersonPutnam, who assembled a small-form-factor GeForce RTX 5090 system. The build is showcased by GeForce host Dwight and the description lists the full component breakdown and links to the PCPartPicker build.
bullets: Contest winner: u/JeffersonPutnamâ€™s SFF GeForce RTX 5090 build featured as the Summer of RTX community build winner.
Chassis: Fractal Design Era 2 small-form-factor case housing the components.
GPU: GeForce RTX 5090 Founders Edition paired with a Ryzen 7 9800X3D CPU.
Support components: MSI MPG B850I Edge motherboard, 32GB Teamgroup T-Create Expert DDR5-6000 RAM, Corsair SF1000 PSU, Corsair Nautilus 240 RS AIO.
Video hosted by GeForce host Dwight; PCPartPicker link to full system provided in the description.
takeaways: A high-end consumer GPU (RTX 5090 Founders Edition) has been fitted into a small-form-factor chassisâ€”power and cooling constraints are critical when integrating similar GPUs into compact deployments.
The build uses a 1000W SFX-class PSU (Corsair SF1000), highlighting that top-tier GPUs may require substantial power delivery even in compact systems.
A 240mm AIO cooler was used in the SFF build, underscoring the need for robust thermal solutions when packing high-performance components into limited volumes.
Mini-ITX motherboard and DDR5 memory were used, so platform form factor and modern memory support should be considered for compatibility and density planning.

items.title: TTEC accelerates AI deployment and revenue streams with Google Cloud Consulting

ai.summary: Based on the available description, TTEC partnered with Google Cloud Consulting to rapidly prototype and deploy GenAI solutions that unlocked new revenue streams while streamlining operations. Sreeni Alakappan highlights that leveraging Google Cloud's infrastructure compressed TTEC's digital transformation timeline and boosted developer productivity.

Generative AI and Google Cloud infrastructure were central to the effort.

takeaways: Ensure infrastructure can support GenAI workloadsâ€”cloud platforms can accelerate deployment timelines.
Partnering with cloud consulting services can compress transformation schedules and reduce internal lift.
Improved developer productivity from cloud tools and platforms can speed time-to-value for AI initiatives.
Successful AI initiatives can create new revenue opportunities while also streamlining operations.
